conclusion: Analyze the process from A to C in two stages: A to B and B to C.
The process from A to B is isothermal because the temperature remains constant.
Use the ideal gas law for isothermal process: PV = nRT.
Calculate work done during isothermal expansion: W = nRT ln(VB/VA).
Heat absorbed in isothermal process equals work done: QAB = W.
The process from B to C is isobaric because the pressure remains constant.
Use the ideal gas law for isobaric process: PV = nRT.
Calculate work done during isobaric expansion: W = P (VC - VB).
Heat absorbed in isobaric process: QBC = ΔU + W, where ΔU = nCV ΔT.
Total heat absorbed from A to C: QAC = QAB + QBC.
General form of solution: QAC = nRT ln(VB/VA) + nCV ΔT + P (VC - VB).
